website_summaries.verdict: A middle of the road distortion pedal with gain, level, bass, and treble controls. Offers total control of distortion sounds.
pros: True bypass loses very little tone
Crunchy, fuzzy bass that lives up to its dark matter name
A staple for grunge, punk, alternative, and metal solos
Impressive sound and range of control for the price
Works well for creating distorted vocal effects
cons: Tends to be a bit bassy

customer_reviews.title: Usable, Musical Distortion
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what this was going to sound like. I wasn't going for any particular tone, but I wanted something a bit more on the distortion side to compliment the Green River Drive I've been using for OD. Took me a while to mess with the EQ and get that right, but now that I've dialed that in I'm really impressed by this guy. Really musical, somewhat crunchy sounds can be achieved across the gain spectrum, but I'm most impressed by the unusually beautiful tones I can get at lower gain settings. It's also great with a boost in front of it for really, stupidly high-gain (but still more vintage sounding) tone.
customer_reviews.author: Aldous Willingham III

customer_reviews.title: It's very good (but not 5-star great)
customer_reviews.text: For the cost, this is a really nice distortion pedal. I have found that TC Electronic makes good, solid-chassis pedals that generally sound quite good. After regularly playing with the OCD and Boss OD-1X however, I cannot place this pedal in that same category but there is certainly nothing wrong with the Dark Matter. Overall, it's a good value and I keep it on my practice pedal board. I primarily use it with a Gibson Les Paul, but also occasionally with a Fender Strat as well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Distortion
customer_reviews.text: I'm playing in a country band these days and needed a distortion pedal that can do a solid mild grit without going too far, as many distortion or overdrive pedals seem to do. The Dark Matter fits perfectly. It'll do a full on distortion as well, but backing off on the gain and level adds just the right amount of dirt for the country tunes that need it. I'm playing a Strat into a Deluxe Reverb RI, and this is the exact sound I was looking for when a Fender clean just doesn't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: nexy jo

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but not what I am looking for.
customer_reviews.text: After having this for some time I changed my rating. While it can make some nice distorted or overdriven sounds and it has a solid reliable design I find myself setting it aside and moving away from it. This might be the pedal for you, but I don't particularly like the sounds I can get out of it. At least it has never failed on me like all those junk EHX pedals. Rock on.
customer_reviews.author: Neverdweller

customer_reviews.title: My guitar skills are still lame but the distortion is amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, you know how people are raving about this and that and this pedal is better than this one and that one is bad? Well I can't give you any of that because I purchased this on a whim. Ended up being the best purchase for my guitar rig. I am no pro, in fact, I still suck at guitar. But dang does my distortion sound awesome!! This also works well with bass guitar and for getting some gnarly distorted vocals.
customer_reviews.author: Don't You Wish

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Drive/light-distortion pedal
customer_reviews.text: I've had good luck using this pedal to get everything from a little punch and drive, making picked chord notes pop without getting grungy... all the way to higher gains bringing "shreddable" single note drive or chuggy distorted drive. It doesn't strike me as immediately as something a "tone-hound" would go after, but for myself it's been a versatile tool that opens up a few great flavors of drive to use. Hard to beat the price for a regular size and very sturdy pedal!
customer_reviews.author: Macster5187

customer_reviews.title: Great distortion
customer_reviews.text: Great pedal, good distortion. I use it to play grunge, punk and alternative rock. For metal sounds is good too, but if you like high gain distortion, maybe you need another pedal. This is an excellent distortion pedal, for this price is the one of the best!
customer_reviews.author: Pol Mejía B.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Is this pedal gonna blow your mind? Hell no. It’s a pretty basic distortion pedal with what I find to be a very shallow sound. It just sounds like it’s missing some lows and mids compared to my other pedals. And the volume knob works on an exponential curve. But. For the price. It’s an amazing deal
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Get one, you will love it.
customer_reviews.text: Stellar pedal! It can do Hard Rock, Metal, Blues, Rock and more. Great pedal for the price. Do not let the black color make you think it is just a metal pedal. That gain knob is very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Manning

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable Value
customer_reviews.text: I had very low expectations on this pedal because the price seemed too good. I haven't tested it with my tube amp yet, but on my Marshall digital double stack it rips. A quality distortion that doesn't lose pitch. You won't find a better value for a pedal that sounds this good. You can get depth, punch, and sharpness really well from this.
customer_reviews.author: Doesn't Matter

customer_reviews.title: It sounds great with this pedal
customer_reviews.text: I bought both this and the MojoMojo pedal. All the MojoMojo did was make my amp louder (Fender Blues Junior). This pedal brought out more of the bluesy growl I wanted. I also have the TC Sentry with the Dark Matter the effects loop. It cuts out the noise when the gain is turned up high. My guitar is a 2017 Fender American Professional (Olive/Rosewood). It sounds great with this pedal.
customer_reviews.author: John Sneddon

customer_reviews.title: 1970's guitar crunch tweaked and refined.
customer_reviews.text: This is basically like being able to tweak every possible setting on an old Marshall. '70s guitar rock crunch. Not much bottom end out of it at all, but sounds great and huge with an overdrive in front of it.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Kenty

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and great sounding pedal!
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say that this isn’t just a distortion pedal. Don’t let the name fool you! It honestly bridges the gap between overdrive and distortion which makes it so versatile. You can get some nice smooth overdriven sounds but can also get really gritty distortion for some heavy metal. The EQ controls are simple. For the money you really can’t beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Torralva

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I use it as a bass distortion. Price for performance I think it's a great value. The sound compared to my Muff Fuzz pedal is cleaner and more precise. And seems to have a clean pass through with no hissing or noises through my pedal board. Seems to play well with my other pedals.
customer_reviews.author: AlTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: Treble AND bass contols
customer_reviews.text: I am hobbyist. I like this and the TC Mojo Mojo, together they produce a great sound through a small amp (Fender EC Vibro Champ). I especially like the that it has treble and bass, rather than just a tone control
customer_reviews.author: othy

customer_reviews.title: great entry level pedal
customer_reviews.text: great entry level pedal, I've only been playing for about a year and play mainly 80's/90's rock and from relatively novice experience with distortion pedals I have no complaints with this TC Electronic Dark Matter pedal. I'm enjoying the added affects I'm able to get now.
customer_reviews.author: BigBlueLeaf

customer_reviews.title: Sounds just like I've wanted for a long time.
customer_reviews.text: This pedal sounds wonderful, smooth yet crunchy, its very versatile. It is the middle part of a trio of pedals that also includes the Rottweiler, super high gain distortion, and MojoMojo, smooth overdrive.Those are great pedals too (I have all three) and they all complement each other well but if I had to have only one pedal it would be the Dark Matter.
customer_reviews.author: og

customer_reviews.title: Is not a distortion pedal. Lite Fuzz at best.
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised as a Distortion pedal. This is lite overdrive and thats being generous. More like a lite fuzz. Looking for a metal tone with bass and clarity but this is definitely not it.
customer_reviews.author: Finn

customer_reviews.title: Dark Matter is a nice distortion pedal and very well done
customer_reviews.text: Dark Matter is a nice distortion pedal and very well done. The distortion is not so powerful, but you can get good sound with the knob controls. The voice switch changes just a little bit the frequency, it's not a great sound transformation. You can feel the changes just when playing very loud. I recommend this stomp if you are not a Heavy Metal guy, maybe a Hard Rocker...
customer_reviews.author: Dimitrius Beck

customer_reviews.title: Good, crisp distortion for clean amps or direct recording.
customer_reviews.text: If your guitar sound involves pushing a cranked amp with some overdrive to make it distort more, this isn't really going to be your thing. However, if you just use a clean pedal platform, or are recording direct, this produces a great, crisp distortion. I didn't find EVERY combination of settings usable, but this did give me some searing lead tones when recorded directly into a preamp.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hill

customer_reviews.title: My two cents
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of this pedal. It did not want to play well stand-alone with my amp nor did it jive well with my other hook-ups. The sounds is good, but the for the title of Dark Matter, I would soften it and make it red rather than the "lets play metal" black.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan&Meghan F

customer_reviews.title: Very bassy
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I don't like the name. This pedal is very bassy even when the bass is off. I could not get a clean tone out of it no matter how much I tweaked it because it was also very muddy and dark- hence the name. Good, quality construction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TC Electronics kills it with HIGH GAIN
customer_reviews.text: great pedal. sounds massive through every amp I've ran it through. For a "cheaper" TC-Elec pedal, you cannot beat it. Now if they had one with the tone print option I'm not sure I'd need another gain pedal. Paired up with its brother MOJO MOJO you have a 1-2 punch combo. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Your Standard Reject

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Man this pedal is amazing. Best bang for your buck on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D. Tank

customer_reviews.title: I like this pedal
customer_reviews.text: I like this pedal.its not high gain or really loud but crank up the volume you do get a decent sound my reason for loving it is you can add any other effects and you get a great sound where as other distortion pedals do not sound good this one sounds great.hendricks style distortion with any effects make this a great pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fun to play!
customer_reviews.text: I am in a band and I use this pedal for distortion effects!
customer_reviews.author: eleanore houghton

customer_reviews.title: excellent pedal. im using it through a Vox AC30CH ...
customer_reviews.text: excellent pedal. im using it through a Vox AC30CH amp head and a Marshall cab and a fender jaguarillo pawn shop series guitar. i did alot of research before i ordered so i knew what i was going to get and that i would be happy with it. the pedal definitely has some range style wise. built solid no play in the knobs or switch. good product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Fleak

customer_reviews.title: As advertised and more.  Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this pedal. It really is something special. Buy it if you want to sound good. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, sturdy, Ok sounding.
customer_reviews.text: Good distortion pedal. Not a really great tone, but OK for the price. It feels very sturdy though, which is a great feature on a pedal. It really feels like I could run a car over it and it would still work.
customer_reviews.author: H. Costa

customer_reviews.title: Good but not ''dirty' enough
customer_reviews.text: I got this for by bass guitar since i cannot afford a good Motorhead style setup. My 25w amp barely handles it up for the price its a good thing to use to annoy your neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Not a horse.

customer_reviews.title: Works like it's advertise
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for something to use on Bass, this works great on guitar but it's not what I need for Bass.
customer_reviews.author: Chester Wright

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your rig set up
customer_reviews.text: Didnt work for my style. Lent it to a friend to see if they like it
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Just another distortion box
customer_reviews.text: I disliked the claim that this was a over the top distortion pedal and it was heavy in distortion, NOT. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF NOTO

customer_reviews.title: great pedal! excellent addition to my board for versatility.
customer_reviews.text: I only give it a 4 because I prefer it when used with an OD before. Other than that, I love it! It is very bassy, so be aware of that, but the active controls make a huge difference. Perfect for leads, and not for very heavy distortion, but amazing for mid gain. Very very worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Another great pedal from T.C. electronics
customer_reviews.text: This pedal is super versatile but put a compressor in front of it as it is very sensitive to your attack. I use it on a low gain setting and it has a tone very reminiscent of a tube overdrive only with more low end.
customer_reviews.author: andrew dewalt

customer_reviews.title: solid distortion
customer_reviews.text: It's a solid dirt box. It's not a fuzz, or overdrive, but if you want a contender to go against a Boss DS-1, this has better tone. That should get you in the ballpark.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: “RAT” alike.  Can’t beat its quality with this price range.
customer_reviews.text: I like this pedal very much. It has a good distortion sound with value to money. You could not beat it with its quality and this price range. It provide vintage and “RAT” alike to my ear. There are 2 modes and it useable for those.
customer_reviews.author: "annops"

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: The distortion was exactly what I was looking for. A sort of non-descript drive box that doesn't sound like a tin can of angry bees. The bass & treble pots add or subtract enough to make most every setting usable.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Killer and dark
customer_reviews.text: I used it with my Ibanez Tubescreamer and the result was incredible. You carry the dark aura of that pedal to your valuable music.
customer_reviews.author: Can Berk O.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and reliability
customer_reviews.text: This pedal can be used for both clean-ish overdrive to good distorted sounds. When used to color the clean sound, it is a more full sound. There is a lot of sustain and the distortion sounds very nice. I've had the pedal for two years without any problems as far as reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you would expect
customer_reviews.text: TC is a great company I love the Proco Rat but the Dark Matter is more versitle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Gain! Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: This little gem is seriously awesome. It absolutely destroys some of my 300 dollar pedals. It can get super heavy and thick. Get this pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, high-quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good value; high quality sound, construction and control. I've been pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Wenner III

customer_reviews.title: Great with humbuckers
customer_reviews.text: As expected, warm tone and compatible with solid state amps. Great with humbuckers.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Luis Herrera

customer_reviews.title: nice pedal
customer_reviews.text: nice pedal. complements my overdrives. would recommend. have many tc electronic pedals - good quality
customer_reviews.author: G. Zupke

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any player
customer_reviews.text: It has a crisp clear Overdrive its not even a distortion
customer_reviews.author: raschwartzy

customer_reviews.title: Love it! This is probably one of the best ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This is probably one of the best metal pedals I've owned! Has a great sound and amazing distortion! Would definitely buy again and recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Only half works
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure this thing is broken outta the box. True bypass truly isn’t working cuz no sound on pass through. Distortion sounds good though. Wish the pedal actually worked. Merry Christmas to me!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My son likes this. He says it does what he expected and is happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: BMessenger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pedal for my son he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as heavy as If like, but pretty dang good
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: GOOD TONE a bit different than digital more sharp ITS ...
customer_reviews.text: GOOD TONE a bit different than digital more sharp ITS GOOD WHEN U NEED A NEW SOUND IF YOU OVERPLAYED DIGITAL PEDAL and LOST YOUREGROOVE!!
customer_reviews.author: DARIO RUBEN ULKEN MEE!!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Does not alter the signal other than the desired distortion
customer_reviews.author: John Cadwallader

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best 50 bucks I ever spent on a pedal. Replaced the Wampler Pinnacle II on my main pedalboard
customer_reviews.author: Jay L. Fagerlie

customer_reviews.title: has a good range of tones
customer_reviews.text: It's well built, has a good range of tones, awesome pedal for the price
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great marshall sound
customer_reviews.text: Very badass pedal. Get you the Marshall sound out of any amp
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Guajardo

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Love it great range of tones on tap. TC make some great gear. This is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Richard facoory

customer_reviews.title: very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Great Sound. Powerful distorsion, many different options available by tweaking the knobs. Looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: paolo moscatelli

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pedal, especially for the price! Lots of range and variability with different setups.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Tirado

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal to use for a wide range of slight ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pedal to use for a wide range of slight distortion to pushing over the top with heavy lead. High end sounds great and gives it a great sound with a fantastic price. A must for every board!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cello

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for darker metal tones. Really good pedal for the price
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great overall, not much noticeable tone difference when engaging the voicing switch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good pedal for the price
customer_reviews.text: overall decent tone, not as chunky as I would have liked
customer_reviews.author: cameron pickard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: An excellent pedal. I produces 0 hiss and a fastantic sound for blues or classic rock.
customer_reviews.author: Illia Levi Loria

customer_reviews.title: Great distortion. Thick and lush tone
customer_reviews.text: What a terrific distortion pedal for the money. Crisp and transparent tone. I love the full range of bass and treble control to tone down the brightness of a tele or crisp up the darkness of a Les Paul. It's all good.
customer_reviews.author: JustinJuk

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pedal. Dynamic in response to the guitar's volume. Driven Marshall sound. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little overdrive, nice and responsive to string attack and a very passable "tubey" breakup, with excellent clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dark Matter Distortion Pedal from TC Electronics
customer_reviews.text: This is THE pedal to have. Covers overdrive and full on distortion. I love the tone you get from this pedal.Sounds great with a Strat or Les Paul. Do yourself a favor and give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gordon

customer_reviews.title: If you want to avoid having to go through the process of learning how terrible Boss/Digitech distortion pedals are
customer_reviews.text: Solid Distortion pedal. If you want to avoid having to go through the process of learning how terrible Boss/Digitech distortion pedals are, start with this one. It will send you down a much better path....and you may be happy sticking with this guy.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Acula

customer_reviews.title: i like it a lot thank
customer_reviews.text: this pedal rock .i like it a lot thank,s guy,s
customer_reviews.author: TERESAF61944

customer_reviews.title: Badass distortion
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe how versatile it is.... Amazing tone... heavy riffs, blues licks and everything you want... Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Loaiza

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy-to-use reverb.
customer_reviews.text: Love the reverb sounds, knobs respond well to settings. I was looking for something fairly simple to use but with good sound. This fits the bill and it's user-friendly. I found a deal on the price. I found myself playing for a long time with this, it was inspiring.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great overdrive
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, that's all I can say. Excellent overdrive with the exact amount of distorcion that i need. I recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Rodriguez Montero

customer_reviews.title: Not for the metal.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to add a little warmth and thickness to leads and also to give me a some new sounds to play around with. I watched a lot of videos of this pedal that made it sound pretty great for the price but I just don't care for it at all with any of my guitars or amps. So for kicks, I ran my Moog Sub Phatty synthesizer through it and WOW! It makes my synth sound downright mean so I'll keep it for that.
customer_reviews.author: Metal1

customer_reviews.title: Distortion effect pedal
customer_reviews.text: this is a great Distortion Pedal true bypass its clean the bass treble pods are great for find tunning..... if your looking for a petal this is the one you want.
customer_reviews.author: James Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the best distortion pedal I've ever played. It really nails that big Plexi-Marshall sound without being noisy or annoying. It has great dynamics and responds to small nuances and changes in your right-hand attack. What a great pedal!
customer_reviews.author: Musician

customer_reviews.title: is the battery bad?
customer_reviews.text: Shouldn't the red light turn on when it's connected to my amp and guitar even if I don't have an AC adapter plugged in..I've pressed the button and tried a few times...is the battery bad?
customer_reviews.author: Chad Montemayor

customer_reviews.title: It's a thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pedal for my Grandson's birthday. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Kay E. Larsson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent crunch and midgain pedal
customer_reviews.text: This pedal was about what I was expecting it to be. I use the midgain to crunch range the most. I don't feel it excels in heavily saturated tones, but that was what I expected. It earned a spot on my pedal board.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B DeAntonio

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pedal for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this 3 days ago, expected on the 9th, arrived today. This pedal is really versatile so far and I love the awesome powerful tones you can get out of it! And the harder you play the string the more OD you get, it's bad ass!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel James

customer_reviews.title: Great Variety
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of other OD pedals on my board that are more "Dumblesque" and wanted something a bit different. Great for bluesy tones or killer in your face distortion. The circuitry allows for great response to the volume control on the guitar...i.e., cleans up real nice. The tone controls actually work very well and very quiet. Extremely responsive to the amount of level of I use when picking. I have this in front of a Fender Vibrolux and Rivera Pubster. Monster pedal for anyone who wants OD or distortion that sounds just like an amp. Works great with TC's Spark Booster. A+
customer_reviews.author: JazzHead

customer_reviews.title: Dark matter effects pedal
customer_reviews.text: The effects pedal met all expectations. It is very versatile and sounds great. I would recommend to anyone, no matter what style of music you play.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald McGee

customer_reviews.title: very nice, but one of the nobs is too tight...
customer_reviews.text: This one is very good, but the level nob is too tight which is kind of a drag...
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Cubero Ocampo

customer_reviews.title: Dark Matter
customer_reviews.text: Distortion is a Ok, TC sells high quality stuff but for me this pedal lacks couple of thing that I was looking for in it. I'm keeping it but it is not on my pedal board.
customer_reviews.author: Elvedin

customer_reviews.title: not very good
customer_reviews.text: 1. Sound is just OK, distortion is average. The fact that the distortion didn't sound any better than my Fender amp's controls was disappointing. 2. Battery life is non-existent. I put batteries in and they were dead in a week. I don't play that much!!
customer_reviews.author: krakenup

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Distortion Pedal!
customer_reviews.text: I can fully shape my distortion tone with this pedal. I put it after my overdrive and before my fuzz pedal. Very versatile pedal. Very much the antithesis of the Boss DS1. I have both on my board!
customer_reviews.author: Thom B.

customer_reviews.title: One and only Distortion effect pedal
customer_reviews.text: Kicks Ass on all distortion pedals it can be tame and dirty or crunchy and down right Nasty w big lo end power switch, add a Octiv effect and Blow your Mind! Math Metal Baby!
customer_reviews.author: BarryDinSmoke

product_meta.title: TC Electronic Dark Matter Distortion Effect Pedal
product_meta.description: Color:MultiColoredDark matter distortion aims to give you that powerful, super-musical roar of an early plexus - A sound that will satisfy even the pickiest players out there.
feature_bullets: Gain, level, bass and Treble controls - total control of your distortion sounds
True bypass - Zero loss of tone
Voicing switch - for an awesome shift in bass response

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars329 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
